attributes.action: Challenge the Local Authorities' policy on booking public buildings
attributes.additional_details: We have tried unsuccessfully to gain the interest of local councils - Winchester who have made some small concessions ignored 3 requests for e-Petitions and Bournemouth who have refused to meet and both have demonstrated intransigence in their responses.
attributes.background: Review access to public venues. Hampshire and Dorset have changed public hire rules, preventing local groups from returning to venues used before the pandemic.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about the use of local authority buildings are a matter for individual local authorities, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
